body_html:
The error message suggests a linker configuration or MKL installation issue. Does libmkl_intel.so exist on your filesystem and is it available to the linker? (You might get some clues from ldd /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so)

FYI @tfboyd in case he has other suggestions.

However, since the distribution (.whl file) you're using is not something maintained by the TensorFlow team, but rather maintained by TinyMind in their github project at https://github.com/mind/wheels - I'm going to suggest that you seek help there.

FYI @tfboyd in case he has other suggestions.
However, since the distribution (.whl file) you're using is not something maintained by the TensorFlow team, but rather maintained by TinyMind in their github project at https://github.com/mind/wheels - I'm going to suggest that you seek help there.
body:
The error message suggests a linker configuration or MKL installation issue. Does `libmkl_intel.so` exist on your filesystem and is it available to the linker? (You might get some clues from `ldd /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so`)

FYI @tfboyd in case he has other suggestions.

However, since the distribution (`.whl` file) you're using is not something maintained by the TensorFlow team, but rather maintained by TinyMind in their github project at https://github.com/mind/wheels - I'm going to suggest that you seek help there.
